I received clear feedback that improved my learning.

What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
Comments_List: I learned how to work in a group setting through the medium of chamber music.
How to play chamber music and collaborate with other musicians!
I developed my abilities to communicate with other members of my group as well as make an intepretation on a piece of chamber music.
I developed more skills in chamber music.
I developed a greater level of comfort in preparing and performing chamber music this semester, particularly in coordinating the musical efforts of a larger ensemble.
Learning how to work together and analyze music through the preparation of a really great musical work!
This course develops skills in not only working on a piece of music but also performing and collaborating.

This is a wonderful course! The only way to improve it would be having consistently scheduled coachings-- I've had previous semesters where I would have two coachings in a weekend and then the same thing would happen two weeks later. I know we have to adjust to the coaches' schedules when they travel, but it's much better/fairer when all the groups get them every week.

The strengths are in the coachings by the wonderful musicians that help teach this class, who really help you in any way possible to form a good sound as a group and to really work through a piece during the semester. I think programming could be improved - there is so much chamber music out there, but I think it would be much more interesting and a much DIFFERENT challenge to learn a chamber piece that is performed less standardly. This is not to say that standard rep should not be given, but I would like to see the course be open-minded towards considering other pieces as the classical music sphere becomes increasingly open-minded as well.

This is a great course with excellent teachers. My complaints are: Sudler is a little dark, it made me tired. Also, it would be great if this class gave a Humanities credit... The Performance of Vocal Music does, so why doesn't chamber?
This course is fantastic! I am so thankful for my chamber group!

This course is very well-structured and ensures that every group has enough rehearsal and coaching time to be adequately prepared at the final concert. The coaches are excellent, and group members are generally matched very well. My one suggestion is that some sort of pre-scheduling for studio classes be organized - it seems like we either have too few groups perform to fill the time, or (more often) too many. One could argue that setting a schedule might result in under-prepared performances in some classes if a group hasn't been given adequate rehearsal time ahead of time, but it could also serve as a good checkpoint to keep each group on track in learning their pieces at a good rate.

I really like the structure of the course! It works really well given our busy schedules  we can still get a lot done, but it's flexible. I appreciate the opportunities to perform in studio class and hear what our classmates, in addition to course faculty, have to say about our playing.
This class has an excellent format of working with multiple coaches, performing and commenting on others in studio class, and rehearsing as a group.
Yes, it is a great course to immerse oneself in the deeper learning of chamber music.
Absolutely! It's wonderful.

I would recommend this course to any student that loves to perform chamber music and learn from wonderful coaches/musicians. If you are okay with learning more standard chamber repertoire (Beethoven, Shostakovich, Brahms, Dvorak) I would recommend this course, but otherwise, be wary that more "untraditional" works will not be performed.
Chamber music is the most awarding musical form there is. Take it if you are a serious musician at yale.
I would recommend this course to anyone interested in pursuing chamber music at a high level.
Best way to play chamber music at Yale take it!

Absolutely! The class is extremely fulfilling as a musical, intellectual, and even social opportunity. The instruction is excellent and every student experiences impressive musical growth over the course of the semester.
Yes! Definitely a time investment if you want to do it well, but so worth it!
I would definitely recommend this course to another student  it is an amazing opportunity to do serious work on chamber music and also learn about working with others and solving problems together.
